title: Illegal instruction (core dumped) for Cuda in 1.0.0.dev
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Get "Illegal instruction (core dumped)" error when trying to copy object in CUDA memory.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

import torch
a=torch.tensor([1.,2.])
a
tensor([1., 2.])
a.cuda()
Illegal instruction (core dumped)

Expected behavior

Object be copied in CUDA memory.

Environment

PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181003
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.2.148

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-27ubuntu1~18.04) 7.3.0
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.1.85
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1070
Nvidia driver version: 396.54
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.2)
[pip] torch (1.0.0.dev20181003)
[conda] cuda92 1.0 0 pytorch
[conda] pytorch-nightly 1.0.0.dev20181003 py3.6_cuda9.2.148_cudnn7.1.4_0 [cuda92] pytorch

Additional context

$ conda create -y --name torch_cuda92
$ conda activate torch_cuda92
$ conda install -y -c pytorch pytorch cuda92

body:
## 🐛 Bug

Get "Illegal instruction (core dumped)" error when trying to copy object in CUDA memory.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

>>> import torch
>>> a=torch.tensor([1.,2.])
>>> a
tensor([1., 2.])
>>> a.cuda()
Illegal instruction (core dumped)

## Expected behavior

Object be copied in CUDA memory.

## Environment

PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181003
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.2.148

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-27ubuntu1~18.04) 7.3.0
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.1.85
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1070
Nvidia driver version: 396.54
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.15.2)
[pip] torch (1.0.0.dev20181003)
[conda] cuda92                    1.0                           0    pytorch
[conda] pytorch-nightly           1.0.0.dev20181003 py3.6_cuda9.2.148_cudnn7.1.4_0  [cuda92]  pytorch

## Additional context

$ conda create -y --name torch_cuda92
$ conda activate torch_cuda92
$ conda install -y -c pytorch pytorch cuda92
